AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: destination for construction job and midpoint in travel to Laredo
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo: destination to pick up commercial equipment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer, Texas: location where an immigration checkpoint is situated and a stop occurred, also involved in a search of a tractor-trailer and prolonged stops, and where conflicting evidence about a Bluetooth was presented, discovered ten undocumented aliens hidden in a tractor-trailer, site of a Border Patrol checkpoint where Raymond McMillon and Zeba Williams were stopped, location of an immigration checkpoint near where Raymond McMillon and Zeba Williams arrived
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where aliens entered or remained in violation of the law
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that addressed Raymond McMillon's case, made determinations on adjustments to his offense level, and denied his § 3B1.2 request based on Zeba Williams' testimony
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court: recognized the constitutionality of suspicionless routine vehicle stops at immigration checkpoints for the limited purpose of ascertaining occupants' citizenship and determining the duration of such a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court record: record of the case where ends-of-justice findings are set forth, includes events that occurred off the record, contains canine records for in camera inspection, used to exclude periods of delay resulting from continuances granted by judges based on ends-of-justice findings, and includes formal notations of events and submissions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.speedy trial case: case where speedy trial determinations are reviewed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: federal law regulating the time between indictment and trial, with a limit of 70 days for trials
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal appeals court that has jurisdiction over cases from Texas and other states, and has ruled on matters related to smuggling and conspiracy
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.suppression hearing: hearing where the voluntariness of Zeba Williams' consent to search was determined, held at the district court level with conflicting testimony and review of checkpoint video evidence, considered factors including custodial status, coercive police procedure, cooperation with police, awareness of right to refuse consent, education and intelligence, and belief that no incriminating evidence will be found
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court's docket: official record of the district court's proceedings, includes formal notations of events and submissions, used to track receipt of canine records for in camera inspection
